thread.title: Findley Davies | BPS&M rebrands as Findley

author: cnbc.com
title: Findley Davies | BPS&M rebrands as Findley
text:
COLUMBUS, Ohio and NASHVILLE, Tenn., Findley Davies | BPS&M – an independent human resources and employee benefits solutions firm with more than 250 associates serving more than 2,000 clients across the country – is now Findley .
The new Findley name is a result of the 2016 merger of Findley Davies with BPS&M (Bryan, Pendleton, Swats & McAllister), and positions the firm for continued growth as a regional and national player in a rapidly changing marketplace. Through the merger, the firm expanded its geographic reach in the U.S. to all 50 states, and deepened industry expertise, especially within the employee stock ownership plans (ESOP) market and the government sector.
“One of our overarching goals during the integration of our two firms was to create a brand that represents our forward thinking vision for the future while exemplifying our culture, dedication to client service and expertise in the marketplace,” said John Weber, managing principal of Findley. “We’re pleased to roll out the Findley name as we continue our evolution with greater geographies, resources and breadth of services.” The company anticipates a continued growth trajectory as it expands its brand through potential acquisitions, new office locations and other opportunities.
Findley has offices in Chicago; Cleveland, Columbus, Ohio and Toledo, Ohio; Louisville, Ky. and Nashville, Tenn. Findley offers consulting and administration services, including: retirement plans, health and group benefits, change management, actuarial, ESOPs and compensation and rewards. The firm serves organizations from nearly all industry sectors including health care, manufacturing, professional services, retail, financial institutions, nonprofits and government entities. Clients range from smaller privately held companies to large multi-national, publicly traded companies with 10,000 or more employees.
“At Findley, we deliver expertise, experience and innovative solutions to help our clients align their people and business strategies to navigate today’s evolving business environment and achieve their business goals,” said Betsy Hammond, principal and chief operating officer of Findley.
The rebranding builds on the firm’s 50-year-old history, evoking a brand recognized for its expertise and experience and ensuring the advancement of the two firms’ shared culture, values, vision and exceptional client service. The dynamic new logo and website represent a progressive approach that makes the complex world of retirement, benefits, human capital and mergers and acquisitions simpler for organizations across the nation. As part of the brand rollout, Findley has introduced a brand promise that reinforces its vision: F lexible, I nnovative, N imble, D ynamic, L oyal, E xperienced and integrit Y (FINDLEY).
About Findley
Findley is an independent human resources and employee benefits consulting and solutions firm that delivers value, responsiveness and expertise to help clients navigate today’s evolving business environment. With 50 years of experience, the firm partners with clients to align people and benefits strategies with business goals. Findley’s more than 250 associates are located in Chicago, Cleveland, Columbus, Ohio, Toledo, Ohio, Louisville, Ky. and Nashville, Tenn., and serve more than 2,000 clients across all 50 states. To learn more visit findley.com .
